2. DRA also to be carried out for each and every hot work being undertaken at the yard.
3. Earthing of the workpiece is used to provide protection against internal insulation failure of the welding transformer and to be checked by EO.
4. Cables to be inspected prior using for insulation and if having low insulation to discard.
5. Cable connectors should be fully insulated when connected.
6. Electrodes are not to be changed with bare hands and every time while changing electrode power to cut and isolate the system.
7. Welding operator to wear non conducting safety shoes and gloves.Clothing should be kept as dry as possible from sweat or water.
8. An assistant is to be in continuous attendance while hot work is in progress(who is to be briefed on the risk of accidental electric shock to the welder and to be ready to cut off power supply instantly).
9. Dry insulation mats or boards are to be used in restricted spaces as and when required.
10. In no circumstances should a welder work while attending in water or with any of his body part immersed in water.
11. When welding operation is completely or temporarily suspended, the electrode should be removed from the holder.
12. Hot electrode ends to be ejected in a suitable container and they are not to be handled with bare hands.
13. Spare electrodes to be kept in a dry and closed container.
14. Maintain a buddy system checking the condition, situation, and progress of task performed.
15.
